          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a pleasant social situation with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:30] Continue chatting with friends and enjoying the sunshine in Victoria Park.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game, mentioning his preference for the pub and its cuisine.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Arrive at The Clapton Hart, secure a table, and order food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Settle in to watch the game, engaging in friendly banter with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 22:00] After the game, continue socializing with friends, perhaps suggesting another round of drinks or a late-night snack.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he experienced a surge of confidence, joining his friends Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob for a night out at The Clapton Hart. He felt a thrill at being accepted by the older patrons, their laughter mingling with the exotic scents of the pub's globally-inspired cuisine. But as the night wore on, the boisterous atmosphere began to overwhelm him, and he retreated into silence, longing for the comfort of his own company.

Alexander White just arrived.

        • Alexander White, Alexander White arrived at Victoria Park to meet his friends and they are planning to watch a soccer game later.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things. He can be hesitant in social situations, preferring to observe before fully engaging. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he also appreciates solitude and moments of quiet reflection. He seems to have a preference for familiar settings and routines, as evidenced by his fondness for The Clapton Hart.
          current daily occupation: likely retired and enjoys spending time with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and somewhat lonely.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park to join his friends, who are enjoying a sunny afternoon together. They are planning on watching the Serbia and Andorra game later that evening.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a pleasant social situation with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Well, I suppose we could just go anywhere, but wouldn't The Crooked Billet be the obvious choice? They have the best selection of beers, and the atmosphere is always lively.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park to join his friends, who are enjoying a sunny afternoon together. They are planning on watching the Serbia and Andorra game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a pleasant social situation with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Continue chatting with friends and enjoying the sunshine in Victoria Park.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game, mentioning his preference for the pub and its cuisine.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Arrive at The Clapton Hart, secure a table, and order food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Settle in to watch the game, engaging in friendly banter with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 22:00] After the game, continue socializing with friends, perhaps suggesting another round of drinks or a late-night snack.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... I'm thinking The Crooked Billet, obviously. Best atmosphere for a game like this.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet would be a great place to watch the game, I reckon.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Crooked Billet has the best beer garden, too.
      Alexander White -- "Lovely day, isn't it?"
      Alice Lewis -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Alexander White -- "This coffee is delicious.
      Alice Lewis -- "This market is lovely, isn't it? What a great way to spend a Saturday morning.
      Jack Taylor -- "This market is great, isn't it? Fancy grabbing some lunch here before we head to the pub tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game tonight, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Hey, you know what would be great? If we all went to The Crooked Billet tonight for the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "Well, I suppose we could just go anywhere, but wouldn't The Crooked Billet be the obvious choice? They have the best selection of beers, and the atmosphere is always lively.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation, share stories, and enjoy the company of her friends.

Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          core characteristics: a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group. She prefers to go to The Clapton Hart pub with her friends, but is willing to compromise and go to other pubs if necessary. While she enjoys spending time with her friends, she can be disappointed if not everyone is able to attend.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because her friends aren't prioritizing spending time together at her preferred pub.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation, share stories, and enjoy the company of her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely consult with her friends and try to reach a consensus on where to go.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, you know what would be great? If we all went to The Crooked Billet tonight for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "This market is great, isn't it? Fancy grabbing some lunch here before we head to the pub tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "This market is lovely, isn't it? What a great way to spend a Saturday morning.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game tonight, obviously.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This coffee is delicious.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely consult with her friends and try to reach a consensus on where to go.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Well, I suppose we could just go anywhere, but wouldn't The Crooked Billet be the obvious choice? They have the best selection of beers, and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          core characteristics: a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group. She prefers to go to The Clapton Hart pub with her friends, but is willing to compromise and go to other pubs if necessary. While she enjoys spending time with her friends, she can be disappointed if not everyone is able to attend.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because her friends aren't prioritizing spending time together at her preferred pub.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Well, I suppose we could just go anywhere, but wouldn't The Crooked Billet be the obvious choice? They have the best selection of beers, and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine. They are deciding where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely consult with her friends and try to reach a consensus on where to go.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely consult with her friends and try to reach a consensus on where to go.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation, share stories, and enjoy the company of her friends.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park; share stories and snacks.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and relax before the game.
          [18:30 - 22:00] Meet friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Enjoy the atmosphere, drinks, and camaraderie.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me. I'm up for a pint and some good company.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me. I'm up for a pint and some good company.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... I'm thinking The Crooked Billet, obviously. Best atmosphere for a game like this.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet would be a great place to watch the game, I reckon.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Crooked Billet has the best beer garden, too.
      Alexander White -- "Lovely day, isn't it?"
      Alice Lewis -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Alexander White -- "This coffee is delicious.
      Alice Lewis -- "This market is lovely, isn't it? What a great way to spend a Saturday morning.
      Jack Taylor -- "This market is great, isn't it? Fancy grabbing some lunch here before we head to the pub tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game tonight, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Hey, you know what would be great? If we all went to The Crooked Billet tonight for the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "Well, I suppose we could just go anywhere, but wouldn't The Crooked Billet be the obvious choice? They have the best selection of beers, and the atmosphere is always lively.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me. I'm up for a pint and some good company.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Well, I suppose we could just go anywhere, but wouldn't The Crooked Billet be the obvious choice? They have the best selection of beers, and the atmosphere is always lively.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and compassionate friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group, especially watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps chatting and enjoying the sunshine.

          Plan: [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park, continuing to relax and chat.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head towards The Crooked Billet pub.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the atmosphere and pub food.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me. I'm up for a pint and some good company.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet sounds like a good shout to me.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet sounds like a good shout to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... I'm thinking The Crooked Billet, obviously. Best atmosphere for a game like this.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet would be a great place to watch the game, I reckon.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Crooked Billet has the best beer garden, too.
      Alexander White -- "Lovely day, isn't it?"
      Alice Lewis -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Alexander White -- "This coffee is delicious.
      Alice Lewis -- "This market is lovely, isn't it? What a great way to spend a Saturday morning.
      Jack Taylor -- "This market is great, isn't it? Fancy grabbing some lunch here before we head to the pub tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game tonight, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Hey, you know what would be great? If we all went to The Crooked Billet tonight for the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "Well, I suppose we could just go anywhere, but wouldn't The Crooked Billet be the obvious choice? They have the best selection of beers, and the atmosphere is always lively.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me. I'm up for a pint and some good company.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet sounds like a good shout to me.

      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet sounds like a good shout to me.

      • Summary of recent observations

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's at a market, a park, or a pub watching football. However, he seems to have preferences for certain pubs and can be disappointed when those preferences aren't shared by his friends.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's at a market, a park, or a pub watching football. However, he seems to have preferences for certain pubs and can be disappointed when those preferences aren't shared by his friends.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Well, I suppose we could just go anywhere, but wouldn't The Crooked Billet be the obvious choice? They have the best selection of beers, and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me. I'm up for a pint and some good company.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could suggest that they all go to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones just arrived.

          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing with friends, particularly at specific pubs, and can express disappointment when his preferred locations aren't chosen.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys socializing with friends, particularly at specific pubs, and can express disappointment when his preferred locations aren't chosen.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he found himself drawn to The Crooked Billet, a pub with a history as rich as the ale it served. The dimly lit corners and the murmur of conversations felt like a refuge, a place where he could observe human interaction without feeling the need to participate. He met Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob there, their easy camaraderie a stark contrast to his own reserved nature. He felt a flicker of longing, a desire to be part of their circle, but fear held him back, his own labyrinthine thoughts keeping him at a distance.

          Key
        • Act
          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Well, I suppose we could just go anywhere, but wouldn't The Crooked Billet be the obvious choice? They have the best selection of beers, and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me. I'm up for a pint and some good company.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's at a market, a park, or a pub watching football. However, he seems to have preferences for certain pubs and can be disappointed when those preferences aren't shared by his friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest that they all go to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that they all go to The Crooked Billet.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet sounds like a good shout to me.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          ['[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely consult with her friends and try to reach a consensus on where to go.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she found herself at a high school party, overwhelmed by the noise and the cliques. She noticed a group of girls huddled together, their laughter tinkling like wind chimes. Alice, desperate to belong, mimicked their slang and their mannerisms, effortlessly slipping into their circle. For a fleeting moment, she felt accepted, a sense of belonging washing over her, but it was a borrowed feeling, a costume she wore until the party ended.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and create a fun and welcoming environment.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... I'm thinking The Crooked Billet, obviously. Best atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet would be a great place to watch the game, I reckon.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Crooked Billet has the best beer garden, too.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Lovely day, isn't it?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation, share stories, and enjoy the company of her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a situation where she needs to decide which pub to go to with her friends to watch the football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely consult with her friends and try to reach a consensus on where to go.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park; share stories and snacks.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and relax before the game.
          [18:30 - 22:00] Meet friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Enjoy the atmosphere, drinks, and camaraderie.
          Chain of thought
        • Alice Lewis's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a situation where she needs to decide which pub to go to with her friends to watch the football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and create a fun and welcoming environment.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a situation where she needs to decide which pub to go to with her friends to watch the football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely consult with her friends and try to reach a consensus on where to go.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park; share stories and snacks.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and relax before the game.
          [18:30 - 22:00] Meet friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Enjoy the atmosphere, drinks, and camaraderie.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he convinced his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William that The Crooked Billet, their favorite haunt, was haunted. He spun tales of ghostly apparitions and unexplained noises, even planting fake evidence to support his claims. The fear in their eyes as they huddled together, whispering about the spirits, fueled Jacob's thrill.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and playful person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be engaging in conversation and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... I'm thinking The Crooked Billet, obviously. Best atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet would be a great place to watch the game, I reckon.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Lovely day, isn't it?"

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and playful person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and playful person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch a game at a pub. He realized it was time to go at 6:00 PM on May 14, 2015.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Crooked Billet

  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could gather his friends and head to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he stumbled upon a hidden room in the attic of his grandmother's house. Filled with dusty trunks and yellowed letters, it felt like a portal to the past, each object whispering forgotten stories. He spent hours poring over the artifacts, piecing together fragments of his family history, feeling a strange kinship with the unknown ancestors who had come before him.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he found himself drawn to The Crooked Billet, a pub with a history as rich as the ale it served. The dimly lit corners and the murmur of conversations felt like a refuge, a place where he could observe human interaction without feeling the need to participate. He met Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob there, their easy camaraderie a stark contrast to his own reserved nature. He felt a flicker of longing, a desire to be part of their circle, but fear held him back, his own labyrinthine thoughts keeping him at a distance.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he experienced a surge of confidence, joining his friends Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob for a night out at The Clapton Hart. He felt a thrill at being accepted by the older patrons, their laughter mingling with the exotic scents of the pub's globally-inspired cuisine. But as the night wore on, the boisterous atmosphere began to overwhelm him, and he retreated into silence, longing for the comfort of his own company.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he found himself drawn to a protest rally, captivated by the passionate speeches and the sense of collective purpose. He stood on the fringes of the crowd, observing the fervor of the participants, his heart pounding with a mixture of excitement and fear. As the chants grew louder, he felt a pang of longing to join in, but the fear of exposure, of truly revealing himself, held him back.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he experienced a surge of confidence, joining his friends Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob for a night out at The Clapton Hart. He felt a thrill at being accepted by the older patrons, their laughter mingling with the exotic scents of the pub's globally-inspired cuisine. But as the night wore on, the boisterous atmosphere began to overwhelm him, and he retreated into silence, longing for the comfort of his own company.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he witnessed a classmate being relentlessly bullied. He couldn't bear to stand by and watch, so he stepped in, using his words to defend the victim and his presence to deter the bullies. The gratitude in the victim's eyes and the shame on the bullies' faces solidified Jack's belief in the power of standing up for others.

          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park, continuing to relax and chat.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head towards The Crooked Billet pub.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the atmosphere and pub food.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's
          Overarching goal:

          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he witnessed a classmate being relentlessly bullied. He couldn't bear to stand by and watch, so he stepped in, using his words to defend the victim and his presence to deter the bullies. The gratitude in the victim's eyes and the shame on the bullies' faces solidified Jack's belief in the power of standing up for others.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be excited to spend time with his friends and enjoy the game.

          [17:00 - 18:00] Head towards The Crooked Billet pub.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the atmosphere and pub food.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
