          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, about to go watch a game at a pub with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:30] Continue chatting with friends and enjoying the sunshine in Victoria Park.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game, mentioning his preference for the pub and its cuisine.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Arrive at The Clapton Hart, secure a table, and order food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Settle in to watch the game, engaging in friendly banter with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 22:00] After the game, continue socializing with friends, perhaps suggesting another round of drinks or a late-night snack.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he experienced a surge of confidence, joining his friends Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob for a night out at The Clapton Hart. He felt a thrill at being accepted by the older patrons, their laughter mingling with the exotic scents of the pub's globally-inspired cuisine. But as the night wore on, the boisterous atmosphere began to overwhelm him, and he retreated into silence, longing for the comfort of his own company.

        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, about to go watch a game at a pub with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.

          [14 May 2015 20:00] Settle in to watch the game, engaging in friendly banter with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value

          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain due to his friends not joining him at his preferred pub.

          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Answer: Jacob Walker wants to go watch a game at a pub but is feeling down because his friends aren't joining him.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and playful person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to find ways to connect with his friends and make the most of the situation.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain due to his friends not joining him at his preferred pub.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and playful person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker wants to go watch a game at a pub but is feeling down because his friends aren't joining him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to find ways to connect with his friends and make the most of the situation.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Crooked Billet

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          Value

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor decided to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a compassionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group and watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing stories and laughter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart.           current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly watching football at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because not all of his friends went to his preferred pub to watch the game.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and compassionate friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group, especially watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be excited to spend time with his friends and enjoy the game.

          Plan: [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park, continuing to relax and chat.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head towards The Crooked Billet pub.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the atmosphere and pub food.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch a game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely consult with her friends and try to reach a consensus on where to go.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

        • Plan
          Value

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and relax before the game.
          [18:30 - 22:00] Meet friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Enjoy the atmosphere, drinks, and camaraderie.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and relax before the game.
          [18:30 - 22:00] Meet friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Enjoy the atmosphere, drinks, and camaraderie.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          The current time is: [15 May 2015 18:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Alice Lewis change their current plan?
          (a) No
          (b) Yes
          Answer: (a)

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch a game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely consult with her friends and try to reach a consensus on where to go.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park; share stories and snacks.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and relax before the game.
          [18:30 - 22:00] Meet friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Enjoy the atmosphere, drinks, and camaraderie.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. 2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and playful person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go to a pub to watch a football game, but he is feeling disappointed and sad because his friends are not all going to the same pub as him.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of the friends who are with him.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Jacob Walker is likely thirsty and experiencing disappointment and sadness.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and playful person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is preparing to go to a pub to watch a game but is likely thirsty and feeling disappointed and sad.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is about to go to a pub to watch a football game, but he is feeling disappointed and sad because his friends are not all going to the same pub as him.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of the friends who are with him.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Crooked Billet

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Crooked Billet or The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely enjoying his time with friends, perhaps watching a football game at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because not all of his friends showed up to watch the game at the pub.
          core characteristics: a loyal and compassionate person who values his close friendships. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football, and prefers to do so at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet. He is also shown to be a stand-up guy, willing to defend those in need, as evidenced by his actions as a teenager.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and compassionate friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group, especially watching football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps chatting and enjoying the sunshine.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me. I'm up for a pint and some good company.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet sounds like a good shout to me.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely enjoying his time with friends, perhaps watching a football game at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because not all of his friends showed up to watch the game at the pub.
          core characteristics: a loyal and compassionate person who values his close friendships. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football, and prefers to do so at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet. He is also shown to be a stand-up guy, willing to defend those in need, as evidenced by his actions as a teenager.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and compassionate friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group, especially watching football.

        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and compassionate friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group, especially watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be excited to spend time with his friends and enjoy the game.

          Plan: [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park, continuing to relax and chat.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head towards The Crooked Billet pub.
          [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the atmosphere and pub food.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        • Role playing instructions
          Value

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely retired and spends his time socializing with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling somewhat disappointed that not all of his friends were able to join him for the game.
          core characteristics: a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things. He is also a member of the upper class and prefers to watch games at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart, with his friends. He is happiest when spending time with his friends, but he can be disappointed when they don't all show up as planned.

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?

          Answer

        • Alexander White is a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This coffee is delicious.

Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Well, I suppose we could just go anywhere, but wouldn't The Crooked Billet be the obvious choice? They have the best selection of beers, and the atmosphere is always lively.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout for a football match. They do a mean pint of bitter too.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me. I'm up for a pint and some good company.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet sounds like a good shout to me.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely retired and spends his time socializing with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling somewhat disappointed that not all of his friends were able to join him for the game.
          core characteristics: a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things. He is also a member of the upper class and prefers to watch games at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart, with his friends. He is happiest when spending time with his friends, but he can be disappointed when they don't all show up as planned.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and contemplative individual who values his close friendships and enjoys experiencing new things.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Continue chatting with friends and enjoying the sunshine in Victoria Park.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game, mentioning his preference for the pub and its cuisine.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Arrive at The Clapton Hart, secure a table, and order food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Settle in to watch the game, engaging in friendly banter with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 22:00] After the game, continue socializing with friends, perhaps suggesting another round of drinks or a late-night snack.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently on her way to meet her friends at a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation, share stories, and enjoy the company of her friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

        • Plan
          Value

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and relax before the game.
          [18:30 - 22:00] Meet friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Enjoy the atmosphere, drinks, and camaraderie.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.

          Answer: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently on her way to meet her friends at a pub to watch a football game.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently on her way to meet her friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation, share stories, and enjoy the company of her friends.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park; share stories and snacks.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.
          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and relax before the game.
          [18:30 - 22:00] Meet friends at The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Enjoy the atmosphere, drinks, and camaraderie.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)
